watering.tip: Allow the soil to dry out completely between waterings. Overwatering is the biggest killer.

sunlight.tip: Extremely versatile, but prefers bright, indirect light for best growth. Avoid direct, harsh afternoon sun.

fertilizing.tip: Use a balanced liquid houseplant fertilizer, diluted to half-strength, during the growing season.

watering.tip: Water when the top inch or two of soil is dry. Leaves will droop dramatically when thirsty, which is a good indicator.

sunlight.tip: Tolerates low light, but its variegation (color) will be more pronounced in brighter light.

fertilizing.tip: A standard houseplant food is sufficient. Reduce frequency in fall and winter.

watering.tip: Treat it like a succulent. It stores water in its thick rhizomes, so err on the side of underwatering.

sunlight.tip: Thrives in low-light environments but will grow faster with more light. Protect from intense direct sun.

fertilizing.tip: Requires very little fertilizer. A slow-release granule or highly diluted liquid works best.

watering.tip: Keep the soil consistently moist, but not soggy. Use distilled or filtered water to avoid brown leaf tips.

sunlight.tip: Prefers shade or indirect light. Too much sun can burn the leaves, too little light reduces flowering.

fertilizing.tip: Use a fertilizer higher in Phosphorus to encourage blooming. Stop fertilizing in winter.

watering.tip: Water thoroughly once the top third of the soil is dry. They appreciate high humidity.

sunlight.tip: Needs bright light to develop the characteristic 'splits' (fenestrations) in its leaves.

fertilizing.frequency: Monthly from spring to early fall
fertilizing.tip: A general-purpose houseplant fertilizer will support its fast growth.
